oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge papers of Wesley McDonald, Co. E, 6th W. Va. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wesley McDonald was from Harrison County, Virginia and enlisted in the regiment in August of 1861. He reenlisted "for the war" in December 1863 and thus earned the title "veteran volunteer" and a $200 reenlistment bounty. The regiment spent most of the war guarding the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad. They mustered out in June 1865.
